to.personal: Google Webmaster Help - Crawling, indexing, and ranking

headers.to: "Google Webmaster Help - Crawling, indexing, and ranking" <[email address]>
headers.subject: Re: Website fell out of Google
headers.received: by l53g2000cwa.googlegroups.com with HTTP; Sat, 17 Feb 2007 14:26:38 +0000 (UTC)

quote.quotepara: Can anyone make any suggestion as to why this as happend?

body.para: Nothing that makes any real sense, but perhaps this is a clue. When I run http://tool.motoricerca.info/spam-detector/ against that site, it picks out "Welcome To Wedding Wheels Ltd - Wedding Car Hire & Special Occasion Transport" as potentially hidden text.
This is a bit odd, because I've seen the same tool fail to pick up text that was, IMO, much better "hidden".

IF Google has banned the site - which seems the case - and IF it was because of this piece of text triggering the same alarm in the Googlebot that the tool above found and IF that's really a false positive then we have another Googlebug. I'd suggest that you change the presentation of that line on the page - even though there's nothing malfeasant about it - and submit a reinclusion request.
The stupid Google form makes you admit guilt before trial, but that's the way America behaves int he world these days.
